verses.verse: ( Sing for Joy to God Our Strength) לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ׀ <WH5329> lam·naṣ·ṣê·aḥ For the choirmaster. עַֽל־ <WH5921> ‘al- According to הַגִּתִּ֬ית <WH1665> hag·git·tîṯ Gittith. ( Gittith is probably a musical or liturgical term; here and in and 84.) לְאָסָֽף׃ <WH623> lə·’ā·sāp̄ Of Asaph. הַ֭רְנִינוּ <WH7442> har·nî·nū Sing for joy לֵאלֹהִ֣ים <WH430> lê·lō·hîm to God עוּזֵּ֑נוּ <WH5797> ‘ūz·zê·nū our strength; הָ֝רִ֗יעוּ <WH7321> hā·rî·‘ū make a joyful noise לֵאלֹהֵ֥י <WH430> lê·lō·hê to the God יַעֲקֹֽב׃ <WH3290> ya·‘ă·qōḇ of Jacob.

שְֽׂאוּ־ <WH5375> śə·’ū- Lift up זִ֭מְרָה <WH2172> zim·rāh a song, וּתְנוּ־ <WH5414> ū·ṯə·nū- strike תֹ֑ף <WH8596> ṯōp̄ the tambourine, כִּנּ֖וֹר <WH3658> kin·nō·wr lyre. נָעִ֣ים <WH5273> nā·‘îm play the sweet-sounding עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- and נָֽבֶל׃ <WH5035> nā·ḇel harp

תִּקְע֣וּ <WH8628> tiq·‘ū Sound בַחֹ֣דֶשׁ <WH2320> ḇa·ḥō·ḏeš at the New Moon, שׁוֹפָ֑ר <WH7782> šō·w·p̄ār the ram’s horn בַּ֝כֵּ֗סֶה <WH3677> bak·kê·seh [and] at the full moon לְי֣וֹם <WH3117> lə·yō·wm on the day חַגֵּֽנוּ׃ <WH2282> ḥag·gê·nū of our Feast.

כִּ֤י <WH3588> kî For חֹ֣ק <WH2706> ḥōq is a statute לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל <WH3478> lə·yiś·rā·’êl for Israel, ה֑וּא <WH1931> hū this מִ֝שְׁפָּ֗ט <WH4941> miš·pāṭ an ordinance לֵאלֹהֵ֥י <WH430> lê·lō·hê of the God יַעֲקֹֽב׃ <WH3290> ya·‘ă·qōḇ of Jacob.

עֵ֤דוּת׀ <WH5715> ‘ê·ḏūṯ as a testimony בִּֽיה֘וֹסֵ֤ף <WH3084> bî·hō·w·sêp̄ for Joseph ( Or in Joseph) שָׂמ֗וֹ <WH7760> śā·mōw He ordained it בְּ֭צֵאתוֹ <WH3318> bə·ṣê·ṯōw when he went out עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- over אֶ֣רֶץ <WH776> ’e·reṣ the land מִצְרָ֑יִם <WH4714> miṣ·rā·yim of Egypt, שְׂפַ֖ת <WH8193> śə·p̄aṯ language: לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- an unfamiliar יָדַ֣עְתִּי <WH3045> yā·ḏa‘·tî ... אֶשְׁמָֽע׃ <WH8085> ’eš·mā‘ [where] I heard

הֲסִיר֣וֹתִי <WH5493> hă·sî·rō·w·ṯî “ I relieved מִסֵּ֣בֶל <WH5447> mis·sê·ḇel of the burden; שִׁכְמ֑וֹ <WH7926> šiḵ·mōw his shoulder כַּ֝פָּ֗יו <WH3709> kap·pāw his hands מִדּ֥וּד <WH1731> mid·dūḏ from the basket. תַּעֲבֹֽרְנָה׃ <WH5674> ta·‘ă·ḇō·rə·nāh were freed

בַּצָּרָ֥ה <WH6869> baṣ·ṣā·rāh in distress, קָרָ֗אתָ <WH7121> qā·rā·ṯā You called out וָאֲחַ֫לְּצֶ֥ךָּ <WH2502> wā·’ă·ḥal·lə·ṣe·kā and I rescued you; אֶ֭עֶנְךָ <WH6030> ’e·‘en·ḵā I answered בְּסֵ֣תֶר <WH5643> bə·sê·ṯer you from the cloud רַ֑עַם <WH7482> ra·‘am of thunder; אֶבְחָֽנְךָ֨ <WH974> ’eḇ·ḥā·nə·ḵā I tested עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- you at מֵ֖י <WH4325> mê the waters מְרִיבָ֣ה <WH4809> mə·rî·ḇāh of Meribah. ( Meribah means quarreling; see .) סֶֽלָה׃ <WH5542> se·lāh Selah

שְׁמַ֣ע <WH8085> šə·ma‘ Hear, עַ֭מִּי <WH5971> ‘am·mî O My people, וְאָעִ֣ידָה <WH5749> wə·’ā·‘î·ḏāh and I will warn בָּ֑ךְ Prep│2ms ( bāḵ) you: יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל 3478 N-proper-ms ( yiś·rā·’êl) O Israel, אִם־ 518 Conj ( ’im-) if only תִּֽשְׁמַֽע־ 8085 V-Qal-Imperf-2ms ( tiš·ma‘-) you would listen לִֽי׃ Prep│1cs ( lî) to Me!

לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- There must be no יִהְיֶ֣ה <WH1961> yih·yeh ... בְ֭ךָ Prep│2ms ( ḇə·ḵā) among you, אֵ֣ל 410 N-ms ( ’êl) god זָ֑ר 2114 Adj-ms ( zār) strange וְלֹ֥א 3808 Conj-w│Adv-NegPrt ( wə·lō) nor shall you תִ֝שְׁתַּחֲוֶ֗ה 7812 V-Hitpael-Imperf-2ms ( ṯiš·ta·ḥă·weh) bow לְאֵ֣ל 410 Prep-l│N-msc ( lə·’êl) god. נֵכָֽר׃ 5236 N-ms ( nê·ḵār) to a foreign

אָנֹכִ֨י׀ <WH595> ’ā·nō·ḵî I יְה֘וָ֤ה <WH3068> Yah·weh am the LORD אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·he·ḵā your God, הַֽ֭מַּעַלְךָ <WH5927> ham·ma·‘al·ḵā who brought you up מֵאֶ֣רֶץ <WH776> mê·’e·reṣ vvv מִצְרָ֑יִם <WH4714> miṣ·rā·yim out of Egypt. הַרְחֶב־ <WH7337> har·ḥeḇ- ..., פִּ֝֗יךָ <WH6310> pî·ḵā Open wide your mouth וַאֲמַלְאֵֽהוּ׃ <WH4390> wa·’ă·mal·’ê·hū and I will fill it.

וְלֹא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- would not שָׁמַ֣ע <WH8085> šā·ma‘ listen to Me, עַמִּ֣י <WH5971> ‘am·mî But My people לְקוֹלִ֑י <WH6963> lə·qō·w·lî ... וְ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל <WH3478> wə·yiś·rā·’êl and Israel לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- would not אָ֥בָה <WH14> ’ā·ḇāh obey לִֽי׃ Prep│1cs ( lî) Me.

וָֽ֭אֲשַׁלְּחֵהוּ <WH7971> wā·’ă·šal·lə·ḥê·hū So I gave them up בִּשְׁרִיר֣וּת <WH8307> biš·rî·rūṯ to their stubborn לִבָּ֑ם <WH3820> lib·bām hearts יֵ֝לְכ֗וּ <WH1980> yê·lə·ḵū to follow בְּֽמוֹעֲצוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ <WH4156> bə·mō·w·‘ă·ṣō·w·ṯê·hem their own devices.

ל֗וּ <WH3863> lū If only עַ֭מִּי <WH5971> ‘am·mî My people שֹׁמֵ֣עַֽ <WH8085> šō·mê·a‘ would listen לִ֑י Prep│1cs ( lî) to Me, יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל 3478 N-proper-ms ( yiś·rā·’êl) if Israel בִּדְרָכַ֥י 1870 Prep-b│N-cpc│1cs ( biḏ·rā·ḵay) My ways, יְהַלֵּֽכוּ׃ 1980 V-Piel-Imperf-3mp ( yə·hal·lê·ḵū) would follow

כִּ֭מְעַט <WH4592> kim·‘aṭ how soon אוֹיְבֵיהֶ֣ם <WH341> ’ō·wy·ḇê·hem their enemies אַכְנִ֑יעַ <WH3665> ’aḵ·nî·a‘ I would subdue וְעַ֥ל <WH5921> wə·‘al against צָ֝רֵיהֶ֗ם <WH6862> ṣā·rê·hem their foes! אָשִׁ֥יב <WH7725> ’ā·šîḇ and turn יָדִֽי׃ <WH3027> yā·ḏî My hand

מְשַׂנְאֵ֣י <WH8130> mə·śan·’ê Those who hate יְ֭הוָה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD יְכַֽחֲשׁוּ־ <WH3584> yə·ḵa·ḥă·šū- would feign obedience ל֑וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) , וִיהִ֖י 1961 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConjImperf. Jus-3ms ( wî·hî) would last forever עִתָּ֣ם 6256 N-csc│3mp ( ‘it·tām) and their doom לְעוֹלָֽם׃ 5769 Prep-l│N-ms ( lə·‘ō·w·lām) ....

וַֽ֭יַּאֲכִילֵהוּ <WH398> way·ya·’ă·ḵî·lê·hū But I would feed you מֵחֵ֣לֶב <WH2459> mê·ḥê·leḇ the finest חִטָּ֑ה <WH2406> ḥiṭ·ṭāh wheat; וּ֝מִצּ֗וּר <WH6697> ū·miṣ·ṣūr from the rock דְּבַ֣שׁ <WH1706> də·ḇaš with honey אַשְׂבִּיעֶֽךָ׃ <WH7646> ’aś·bî·‘e·ḵā I would satisfy you. ”
